mcqs.question: What is the main purpose of a CSS reset or normalization?
options: To add new colors to a website
To ensure consistent default styling across browsers
To change all fonts to Arial
mcqs.explanation: CSS resets/normalizations help make elements look and behave consistently across different browsers by removing or adjusting default styles.

mcqs.question: Which of the following is a popular CSS normalization library?
mcqs.explanation: Normalize.css is widely used to normalize browser default styles.

mcqs.question: What does the universal selector `*` do in a CSS reset?
mcqs.explanation: The universal selector `*` applies the specified styles to all elements.

mcqs.question: Where should a CSS reset be placed in your stylesheet?
options: At the top, before custom styles
mcqs.explanation: A CSS reset should be placed at the top of the stylesheet so custom styles can override it.

mcqs.question: Which of the following is NOT a normal effect of a CSS reset?
mcqs.explanation: A CSS reset does not force all fonts to bold; it removes or normalizes spacing and other styles.

mcqs.question: Which rule removes default spacing from all elements?
mcqs.explanation: The universal selector resets margin and padding for all elements.

mcqs.question: What is a drawback of using an aggressive CSS reset?
options: It may remove useful default styles you want to keep
mcqs.explanation: Aggressive resets may remove helpful defaults, requiring you to manually re-add them.

mcqs.explanation: This code ensures all elements use `border-box` sizing, which includes padding and border in width/height calculations.

mcqs.question: Which is an effect of Normalize.css?
options: Makes elements render more consistently across browsers
mcqs.explanation: Normalize.css helps elements render more consistently without removing all default styles.

mcqs.question: If you use both a CSS reset and Normalize.css, what can happen?
options: It will always improve your site
There may be conflicts or redundant styles
It will make your CSS faster
mcqs.explanation: Using both can cause conflicts or redundancy; usually you should pick one approach.

mcqs.question: What is the purpose of Sanitize.css?
options: To normalize and improve browser default styles
mcqs.explanation: Sanitize.css normalizes and improves browser defaults, similar to Normalize.css.

mcqs.question:
What is the result of this code?
```css
* { box-sizing: border-box; }
```
mcqs.explanation: `* { box-sizing: border-box; }` makes all elements use the border-box sizing model.

mcqs.question: Why is it important to normalize or reset CSS before starting a project?
mcqs.explanation: Normalizing or resetting CSS ensures that your website looks the same in all browsers.

mcqs.question: Which is a best practice when using a CSS reset?
options: Only use it on mobile sites
mcqs.explanation: It's best to adjust resets to your project's needs.

mcqs.question: What is a common effect of a CSS reset on headings like `<h1>`?
options: Removes default margins and font size
mcqs.explanation: Resets often remove default margins and font sizes from headings.
